dialogues.text: Just wait till you see what we've got waiting for you at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE, in a wheelchair, is being led down a hallway with her family. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an incredible relief to be leaving the hospital.  I'm so sick of looking at my doctor, listening to Frankenstein ask me stupid questions about what I was feeling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE is being wheeled to the front door of the hospital NICOLE (voice over, continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thought it was cute when I called him Frankenstein.  It wasn't.  I feel like his monster. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it a lovely day? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to summer? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer's over.  It's fall. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And winter? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, winter's far behind us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was it? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a terrible winter last year, didn't we, Sam? SAM nods. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing I was in Florida. MARY doesn't know quite what to make of NICOLE'S joke.  S flashes NICOLE a smile.  She doesn't return it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE arrives at home.  The car pulls up in front of the modest house. SAM opens the door and puts the wheelchair up next to it. He points out the ramp he has built for NICOLE. The ramp is painted green. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like it, Nicole? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ramp? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty slick, eh? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very slick. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like the colour? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I had to widen a few doors. You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the house.  The interior of the house is dark and somewhat tawdry.  The BURNELL'S are almost poor. But SAM then leads NICOLE into the special room he has bu for her.  It seems like another world.  Every detail has been lovingly attended to.  No expense has been spared to make this room as attractive and inviting as possible. A room that a guilty, abusive father might dream up for h crippled daughter. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? Pause.  NICOLE wheels around, trying to control her emoti as she inspects the room.  A phone rings in the backgroun MARY goes to answer it. NICOLE fixes her gaze at the back of the door. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door needs a lock. SAM (taken aback)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  I'll fix it right away. SAM goes to get his tools.  JENNY stares at NICOLE. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come and visit you here? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better.  And you can sleep in my new bed with me too. NICOLE grabs her sister's hand, and JENNY moves in close her.  SAM comes back with the tools.  He starts to screw the hook. NICOLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too high.  I'll never reach it. SAM (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  I better get some spackle. SAM leaves again. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy says you need to lock the boys out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What boys? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. NICOLE stares at JENNY, as MARY comes back into the room. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you like your new room? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's interesting. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Dad spent all his spare time in here.  He wanted to make it absolutely perfect. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like a princess. SAM comes back and begins to work on the door.  NICOLE watches him.  She notices a new computer on a desk. NICOLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this mine? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  It's a present. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From you? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  From Mr. Stephens.  That was him on the phone just now.  He was calling to see how you were. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Mr. Stephens? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a lawyer.  He's our lawyer. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Mom have a lawyer? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes.  He's your lawyer too. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lawyer?  Why do I need a lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we shouldn't be talking about this just now, with you barely home. Aren't you hungry, honey?  Want me to fix you something? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  What's this lawyer business? MARY turns to JENNY. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny, why don't you go and play outside? JENNY looks at NICOLE. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's given me some stuff too.  Toys, and some books... MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny. JENNY turns to leave.  When she's outside, MARY continues MARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a very kind man.  And he knew that you'd need a computer for doing schoolwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE wheels her chair to the exterior porch, where she watches her sister climb a tree.  SAM follows her outside SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's because of the accident, Nicole.  Most people in this town whose kids were on the bus have got lawyers.  A lot of people...well, people in this town are very angry. Us included. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't lose me. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, honey.  And we will thank the Lord for that every day and night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: for the rest of our lives.  But you almost died, and you were badly injured, and you won't be...you can't... NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't walk anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE'S P.O.V. of JENNY playing on a tree branch. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to need special care for a long time to come.  It's not going to be easy.  Not for you, not for any of us.  Because we love you so much.  And it's going to cost money.  More than we can imagine. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about insurance?  Doesn't insurance pay for these things? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partly.  But there's a lot the insurance doesn't cover.  That's one of the reasons we have a lawyer.  To make sure the insurance gets paid and to help us look after the rest. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will he do that? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Stephens is representing several families.  The Ottos, the Walkers, us, and I think a couple more.  Mr. Stephens is suing the town for negligence.  He's sure that the accident could have been avoided if they had done their jobs right. He's a very smart man. NICOLE stares at her sister who's at the top of the tree. JENNY turns to look back at NICOLE. There's a tension, as it seems as though JENNY is going t let herself fall. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the first thing I heard about you.  That you were a smart man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you  were so smart that you were going to sue the town, then make us all feel better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK to the scene outside the gas station between MITCHELL and BILLY. The cell phone in MITCHELL'S car has begun to ring.  The men stare at each other. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good at that.  Good at getting people to believe you could do something for them.  Something they could never do for themselves. MITCHELL breaks the silence. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my daughter.  Or it may be the police to tell me that they've found her dead.  She's a drug addict. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this? MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you this because we've all lost our children, Mr. Ansel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MITCHELL stares at the sleeping figure of ALISON. MITCHELL (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dead to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the scene between BILLY and MITCHELL.  The cellul phone is ringing.  MITCHELL breaks the stare with BILLY a moves to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera follows him, as BILLY moves back to his truck the background.  MITCHELL gets in his car and picks up th phone. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'll accept the charges. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling because I've got some news for you, Daddy.  Some big news. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: News? ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to hear? MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Give me your news, Zoe. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always think you know what I'm going to say, don't you?  You always think you're two steps ahead of me. The lawyer. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me your news, Zoe. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I went to sell blood yesterday.  That's how it is.  I'm in this fucking city where my father is a hot shit lawyer, and I'm selling my blood. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not news, Zoe. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But this is.  They wouldn't take my blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Image of ZOE as a little girl in MITCHELL'S lap.  Her fac is swollen.  She is being driven to the hospital. MITCHELL is singing her a lullaby. MiTCHELL's conversation with ZOE continues over this imag ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what that means, Daddy? Does it register? MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tested positive. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to hard times, Daddy. Pause. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do, Zoe? I'll do whatever you want. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need money. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't ask me that!  Not anymore! You asked me what I wanted.  Not what I wanted it for.  I want money. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the blood test? ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me?  You don't fucking believe me? MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of...course I do.  I just thought...I could get you another

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: test.  In case the one you got...was wrong. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it when you don't believe me, Daddy.  It's better you don't believe me but have to act like you do. Pause. ZOE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hear you breathing, Daddy. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I can hear you breathing too. ZOE begins to cry over the phone. ZOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I'm scared. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Zoe.  I'll be there soon, and I'll take care of you.  No matter what happens.  I'll take care of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MITCHELL is still staring at the sleeping figure of ALISO ALISON'S blanket has fallen to the side. MITCHELL lifts the blanket, and covers the sleeping figur of the young woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MITCHELL drives up to the BURNELL home.  He gets out of h car and walks to the front door. SAM has repainted the ramp. It is now red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MITCHELL meets NICOLE.  SAM and MARY are also seated at t table. The meeting takes place in the kitchen/diningroom. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Nicole, I've been wanting to meet you for a long time now.  Not just because I've heard so many good things about you, but because, as you know, I'm the guy representing you and your mom and dad and some other folks here in town.  We're trying to generate some compensation, however meager, for what you have suffered, and at the same time see that an accident like this never happens again.  You're central to the case I'm trying to build, Nicole.  But you'd probably just as soon let the whole thing lie.  Just get on with your life as quickly and smoothly as possible. NICOLE nods.  Pause, as MITCHELL waits for her to go on. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like thinking about the accident.  I don't even remember it happening.  Besides, it just makes people feel sorry for me, and... MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hate that. NICOLE nods. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she means, Mitch... MITCHELL silences SAM with a gesture of his hand. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People can't help it, you know. They really can't.  When they see you in this wheelchair, knowing what your life was life eight months ago, people are going to feel sorry for you.  There's no way around it, Nicole.  You and I just met, and already I admire you.  Who wouldn't? You're a brave tough smart kid. That's obvious.  And I didn't know you, know how exciting and promising

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: your life was before the accident. But listen, even I feel sorry for you. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can only feel lucky that you didn't die for so long.  Then you start to feel...unlucky. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you didn't die?  Like the other children? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Like Bear and the Ansel twins and Sean and... MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole! NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth. MITCHELL regards MARY with calm authority, as though he's telling her the time. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the truth. Pause.  MITCHELL looks back at NICOLE. MITCHELL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be strange if you didn't feel that way. NICOLE (after a slight pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do for you, Mr. Stephens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT fifteen minutes forward.  The scene shifts to th livingroom. MITCHELL and NICOLE are alone in the room.  SAM comes bac from another room, as MARY appears from the kitchen with plate of cookies. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That got you talking about depositions and lawyers.  By the time Daddy came back from the washroom and Mom came in with her tea and cookies, you were going on about how tough it would be for me to answer some of the questions those other lawyers would ask . MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They work for the people we're trying to sue.  Their job is to try to minimize damages.  Our job, Nicole, is to try to maximize them. You have to think of it that way. As people doing their jobs.  No good guys or bad guys.  Just our side and their side. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't lie. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to lie. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is that it was an accident, and no one's to blame. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as an accident, Nicole.  Not in a situation like this. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem very sure about that. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm absolutely positive. NICOLE turns to face SAM.  She stares at him. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what I'm asked, I'll tell the truth. SAM looks back, expressionless. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine.  I want you to be absolutely truthful.  And I'll be right there to advise and help you. And there'll be a court stenographer there to make a record of it, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: that's what'll go to the judge, before the trial is set.  It'll be the same for everybody.  They'll be deposing the Ottos and the Walkers, the bus driver... NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Dolores...and even your mom and dad.  But I'll make sure you go last. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can keep on getting well before you have to go and do this. It's not going to be easy, Nicole. Do you understand that? NICOLE nods. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do they award damages? MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends.  This could drag on for quite a while.  But we'll be there at the end, Sam.  Don't you worry. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, I hated my parents - Daddy for what he knew and had done, NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and even Mom for what she didn't know and hadn't done.  You told me it wasn't going to be easy.  But as I sat there, staring at Daddy, I knew it was going to be the easiest thing in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPLAY of the scene of SEAN WALKER entering the bus.  He turns around to face his mother. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to stay with you. RISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on now.  Go on. SEAN hesitantly turns to face the inside of the bus.  He sees NICOLE BURNELL, who pats the seat beside her. MASON leaves his place beside NICOLE to make way for SEAN NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Sean, sit next to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLORES as she watches SEAN move towards NICOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLORES gives her deposition.  A stenographer takes notes MITCHELL listens, along with SCHWARTZ, the opposing lawye DOLORES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never took his eyes off his mother, even as he moved to sit beside Nicole.  He looked frightened. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he be frightened? DOLORES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  But it was weird in terms of what happened next.  Sean was still watching his mother. DOLORES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shut the door with one hand, and released the brake with the other, and waited for a second for Risa to cross in front of the bus.  There was a sixteen wheeler behind me, and I heard his air brakes hiss as the driver chunked into gear.  I looked into the side view mirror, and saw him move into line behind me.  Then suddenly Sean shrieked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEAN leaps to the front of the bus. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy! MITCHELL (voice over, from the court chamber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened then? DOLORES (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean was all over me, scrambling across my lap to the window.  I glimpsed  Risa off to my left, leaping out of the way of a red Saab that seemed to have bolted out of nowhere. The scene is horrifying, as SEAN watches his mother just missing a terrible accident with the speeding vehicle. DOLORES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean!  Sit down!  Your Mom's okay! Now sit down! SEAN sits back down beside NICOLE.  DOLORES slides open h window, and speaks to RISA. DOLORES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get his number? RISA is stunned. DOLORES (CONT'D) (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was shaken, standing there with her arms wrapped around herself. DOLORES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shook her head, turned away, and walked slowly back to the office.  I drew a couple of breaths and checked Sean, who was seated now but still craning and looking after his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deposition continues. DOLORES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smiled at him, but he only glared back at me, as if I was to blame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL VIEW of the bus as it makes its way through the mountains.  NICOLE'S voice is heard reading The Pied Pipe from the scene with the ANSEL children. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For he led us, he said, to a joyous land, Joining the town and just at hand, Where waters gushed and fruit-trees grew, And flowers put forth a fairer hue, And everything was strange and new...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A montage showing the faces of the various children in th bus.  These images are intercut with DOLORES'S deposition

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deposition.  DOLORES is trying to control her emotion DOLORES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember wrenching the steering wheel to the right and slapping my foot against the brake petal.  I wasn't the driver anymore. DOLORES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus was like this huge wave about to break over us.  Bear Otto, the Lambston kids, the Hamiltons, the Prescotts, the teenaged boys and girls from Bartlett Hill, Sean, Nicole Burnell, Billy Ansel's twins, Jessica and Mason...all the children of my town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM and JENNY are watching television.  Lumberjack log- rolling. NICOLE, in her wheelchair, is reading a book off to one corner.  MARY comes into the room. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Billy Ansel on the phone. He wants to come over to talk to us. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say what about? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he drinking?  Could you tell? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny, it's time for you to go to bed. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom... SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jen.  I let you watch your nature show. JENNY reluctantly kisses her father goodnight, then NICOL As she leaves the room, MARY starts clearing the table. SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he coming over now?  Right away? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he said. SAM is anxious.  He looks over to NICOLE. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you up to, Nicole? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing good on your T.V.? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As opposed to this T.V.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE stares at SAM. NICOLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I'd like to see Billy. NICOLE stares at the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the television screen, an image of a studio audience applauding.  The image is silent.  The T.V. is on MUTE. NICOLE (CONT'D) (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't true.  I didn't want to be seen by anyone whose kids had been killed by the accident. Especially not Billy Ansel. NICOLE turns her attention back to her parents. NICOLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, now that I think about it, I'd just as soon stay in my room. NICOLE shoves her wheelchair towards her room, as the cam remains on her face. NICOLE (CONT'D) (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remembered all the times I had tucked Jessica and Mason into bed. How they loved to have me read to them before they slept.  There was nothing for me to say to Billy, except I'm sorry.  I'm sorry that your children died when my parent's children didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY pulls up to the BURNELL home.  He gets out of his p up and approaches the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From her room, NICOLE watches as BILLY approaches the hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves her view as a knock is heard at the door.  NICO wheels over to the door and presses her ear to the door s that she can hear the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Billy!  What brings you out on a night like this?  C'mon in.  Take a load off. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a cup of tea, Billy? There's a piece of cake left. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, thanks, Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM leads BILLY into the livingroom. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what brings you out tonight? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Sam, I might as well tell you the truth.  It's this lawsuit you've gotten yourself all involved with. I want you to drop the damned thing. Pause. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how that concerns you, Billy. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does concern me. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know why it should. There's a whole lot of people in town involved with lawsuits.  We're hardly unique here, Billy.  I mean, I can understand how you feel. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it being so depressing and all.  But it's reality.  You can't just turn this off because you happen to think it's a bad idea. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's what we have to do. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't want a damned thing to do with it. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine.  So...stay out of it. Pause.  BILLY stares at SAM.  Tension. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've tried to stay out of it.  But it turns out that's not so easy, Sam.  You've gone and got yourself this lawyer.  Mitchell Stephens. You and Risa and Wendell and the Ottos. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?  I mean, lot's of folks have got lawyers. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But yours is the one who's going to subpoena me, Sam.  Force me to testify in court.  He came by the garage this afternoon.  Gave me this piece of paper. BILLY reaches into his pocket and shows the paper to SAM. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he do that?  You didn't have anything to do with the accident. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I was driving behind the bus, Mary.  Because I saw it.  I saw it happen... BILLY is harrowed by this image.  SAM and MARY stare at h frightened by his intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that bastard does subpoena me, if he forces me to go over this again, then all those other lawyers will line up behind him and try and do the same thing. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't happen, Billy.  Mitch Stephens' case is small, compared to some of those other guys.  The way he told me, all he needs is for you to say what you saw that day, driving behind the bus.  I know it's a painful thing to do, but it'll only take a few minutes of your time.  That'll be the end of it. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wrong, Sam.  You know that. We'll be tangled up in this thing for the next five years.  This is never going to go away... SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, you know that won't... BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got lawyers suing lawyers because some people were stupid enough to sign on with more than one of the bastards.  We've got people pointing fingers, making side deals, and dickering over percentages. Yesterday, I heard somebody wants to sue the rescue squad.  The rescue squad.  Because they didn't act fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE listening from her door. BILLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you two dropped the case, then the others would come to their senses BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and follow.  You're good sensible parents, you and Mary.  People respect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Billy.  We can't drop the lawsuit.  You know how much we need the money. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  You got money from Dolores' insurance with the school board.  We all did. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not enough.  For hospital bills.  For Nicole. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help pay for Nicole, if that's what you're really talking about. I'll even give you the money I got for my kids. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we used to do, remember? Help each other.  This was a community. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. BILLY stares at SAM. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to like it here.  I used to care about what happened.  Now I think I'll sell my house and move the fuck away. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, please.  The children. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children. BILLY looks at SAM and MARY, s strange smile on his face. He moves to leave.  He pauses at the door of the kitchen. BILLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is Nicole?  Is she around? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's resting.  In her room. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY walks to his car.  SAM and MARY watch him from the porch/ramp. SAM (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting on with our lives, Billy.  Maybe it's time you got on with yours. BILLY turns around, looks at SAM one final time, then mov to his pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE is watching BILLY from her window.  She is crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE'S P.O.V. of BILLY driving away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE is lying in her bed.  A knock at the door.  SAM enters the dark bedroom and sits on the bed beside her. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sleeping? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole, tomorrow Mr. Stephens wants you to make your deposition at the courthouse.  I thought I'd take you over. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem...I don't know...well, distant, I guess.  Hard to talk to. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used to talk a lot, didn't we, Daddy.  About all the things you were going to do for me. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I'm a wheelchair girl now. It's hard to pretend I'm a beautiful rock star.  Not like you used to tell me.  Remember, Daddy?  All the people that were going to discover me?  Where are they now? SAM turns away from NICOLE. NICOLE (CONT'D) (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't look at me.  But I looked at him.  Right at him.  His secret was mine now.  We used to share it.  But not anymore.  Now, I owned it completely. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, okay.  I'll take you about nine-thirty in the morning.  That's okay with you? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Silence.  SAM gets up to leave the room. NICOLE (CONT'D) (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before, everything had been so confusing.  I never knew who was to blame.  But now I know.  He's just a thief, a sneaky thief who had robbed his daughter.  Robbed me of...whatever it was that my sister still had and I didn't.  And then the accident robbed me of my body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM and NICOLE are driving to town.  They don't exchange word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM is carrying NICOLE up the stairs of the community centre. There is no ramp, so the wheelchair is left at the bottom He is having difficulty, because NICOLE is keeping her bo stiff and won't hold on to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE is wheeled across the floor of the community centr to a table where the depositions are being made.  MITCHEL SCHWARTZ, and the STENOGRAPHER are waiting for her. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last time I was in the community hall was for the big Christmas party almost a year ago.  It hadn't changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deposition.  SAM watches his daughter as she speaks confidently into the microphone.  The STENOGRAPHER takes notes. NICOLE is answering questions from the opposing lawyer. MITCHELL is also taking notes. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now on that morning, did there come a time, Nicole, when you left your parents' house? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time in the morning was this? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About eight-thirty in the morning. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was anyone waiting for the bus with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I was alone.  My sister Jenny was sick and stayed home that day. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there anything unusual about the driver, Dolores Driscoll, or the bus that particular morning? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?  I mean, I don't remember a lot.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I object to the form of that question.  Note that. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was the bus on time? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where did you sit that morning? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My usual place.  On the right side. The first seat. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And according to your recollection, there was nothing unusual about the drive that morning? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until the accident?  No. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, there was.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Worried about this new information. NICOLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was when Sean Walker got on.  He was crying and didn't want to leave his mother.  Mason Ansel was sitting beside me.  I asked him to move, so I could quiet Sean down.  When the bus started up, a car came around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the corner and almost hit Sean's mother.  She was okay, but it really scared Sean, because he watched it out the window. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And was this incident caused in any way by anything the driver of the bus did? Pause.  MITCHELL is nervous. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she hadn't even started to move the bus.  It was the car's fault. MITCHELL is relieved. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was nothing reckless in Mrs. Driscoll's behavior? MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I object to that form of question. Note that. NICOLE (answering the question)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did there come a time when all the children had been picked up? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember that much? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I'm talking, I'm remembering more about it. MITCHELL is worried. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Note my objection.  She said, 'As I'm talking.' SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did there come a time when the bus turned off Staples Mill Road onto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Marlowe Road at what's called Wilmot Springs? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a brown dog that ran across the road up there, right by the dump, and Dolores slowed down not to hit him, and he ran into the woods.  And then Dolores drove on and turned onto the Marlowe road, as usual.  I remember that.  I'm remembering it pretty clearly. SCHWARTZ (eyebrows raised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. MITCHELL (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Note that she said 'pretty clearly'. Not 'clearly'. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what was the weather like at this time? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was snowing. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless the report from the National Weather Bureau for the district on January 23 goes into the record, I will object to that question. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will offer that report.  Well, then, now that your memory seems to be clearing, can you tell us what else  you observed at that time? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the actual accident? SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. NICOLE stares at her father as she responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you scared? SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is before the accident, Nicole. Do you understand what I'm asking? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I understand. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you scared? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores was driving too fast. Silence.  MITCHELL is watching his entire case crumble. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs.  Driscoll was driving too fast? What made you think that, Nicole? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speedometer.  And it was downhill there. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could see the speedometer? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I looked.  I remember clearly now.  It seemed we were going too fast down the hill.  I was scared. NICOLE looks at MITCHELL, who stares back. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How fast would you say Mrs. Driscoll was going?  To the best of your recollection? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy-two miles an hour. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy-two miles an hour?  You're sure of this? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe that the bus driven by Mrs. Driscoll was going at seventy- two miles an hour at this time? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I was positive.  The speedometer was large and easy to see from where I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speedometer from NICOLE'S P.O.V.  It reads fifty-one miles an hour. SCHWARTZ (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw the speedometer? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say anything to Mrs. Driscoll? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared.  And there wasn't time. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There wasn't time? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Because the bus went off the road.  And crashed. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember this? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I do now.  Now that I'm telling it. MITCHELL (defeated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said, 'Now that I'm telling it'. Note that. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you remember about the accident? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember the bus swerved, it just suddenly swerved to the right, and it hit the guardrail and the snowbank on the side of the road, and then it went over the embankment there, and everyone was screaming and everything.  And that's all.  I guess I was unconscious after that. That's all.  Then I was in the hospital. SCHWARTZ smiles and makes some notes in his pad.  He talk to MITCHELL without looking up. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any questions, Mr. Stephens? MITCHELL stares silently at NICOLE for a long time. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy was leaning forward in his chair, his mouth half open, as if he wanted to say something.  Like what, Daddy?  Like 'What about my money?' NICOLE and SAM stare at each other. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no questions. SCHWARTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Nicole. NICOLE wheels herself away.  She passes MITCHELL. MITCHELL (in a low voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd make a great poker player, kid. NICOLE wheels herself over to her father. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE is in the car in front of the community centre.  S stares at SAM as he argues with MITCHELL on the steps. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy took a long time.  I guess he wanted to have a few words with you. He must have tried to tell you that I was lying.  Then you would tell Daddy that it didn't matter if I was lying or not, the lawsuit is dead. As NICOLE'S words are heard, her point of view of SAM and MITCHELL arguing is seen. The movement of their lips is in sync with NICOLE'S voice over. NICOLE (CONT'D) (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's lawsuit is dead.  Forget it.  Tell the others to forget it. It's over.  Right now, Sam, the thing you've got to worry about is why she lied.  A kid who'd do that to her own father is not normal, Sam. SAM comes down the stairs and enters the car, sitting dow at the driver's seat.  NICOLE stares at him as he starts car. NICOLE (CONT'D) (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Daddy knows who lied.  He knows who the liar is.  He knows who's normal. SAM stares ahead, not knowing what to do next. NICOLE (CONT'D) (speaking to SAM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope he lets us keep the computer. SAM turns to look at NICOLE. NICOLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like an ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MITCHELL is at the baggage section of the arrival area, waiting for his luggage. He watches PETER, the man he met in the washroom changing his daughter, playing with the little girl. PETER is full of love as he swings the little girl into t air as she laughs. MITCHELL is caught in a daydream, smiling at the happy im of father and daughter.  ALISON approaches him. ALISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was nice meeting you again, Mr. Stephens. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell.  It was nice to see you again, Ally. ALISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison. ALISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hi to Zoe. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. ALISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope she gets better. MITCHELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell her that. ALISON shakes MITCHELL'S hand, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM wheels NICOLE along a path away from the same concess stand that was seen at the beginning of the film.  NICOLE licking an ice-cream cone.  Around them, people are setti up the bandstand. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, can we come to the fair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Sunday night?  That's always the best time. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. NICOLE looks at a team of men constructing a ride.  A sch bus pulls up, and a group of children spill out.  NICOLE watches as the driver tries to form them into a group. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to happen to Dolores? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will the police do anything to her? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late for that.  She can't drive the bus anymore.  The school board saw to that right off. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll move away. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's talk of that. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someplace where no one knows her. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someplace strange and new. SAM is frozen.  NICOLE smiles to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the airport, in the arrivals bay, MITCHELL waits for h limousine. Across the road, a hotel minibus is parked.  The driver i DOLORES.  The camera settles on her face as she stares at MITCHELL. MITCHELL catches her gaze, and the two stare at each othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you see each other, almost two years later, I wonder if you realize something. MITCHELL'S limo arrives.  He gets inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP of MITCHELL as he stares ahead, lost in thought. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if you realize that all of us - Dolores, me, the children who survived, the children who didn't - that we're all citizens of a different town now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY watches as a crane lifts the demolished schoolbus o a flatbed truck. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A town of people living in the sweet hereafter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE and SAM driving home from the fairground. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether others defend us, protect us, love us or hate us - they do it to meet their own needs, not ours. The camera leaves the car to look up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunday night at the fairground.  NICOLE is staring at the ferris wheel.  In her imagination, the swinging cars of t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slowly turning wheel are full of children.  The laughter noise is haunting. NICOLE smiles as she stares at this private apparition. NICOLE (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I learned.  This is what I found out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE has just finished reading a story to JESSICA and MASON.  The children are asleep.  NICOLE puts the book do and kisses the two sleeping children on the cheek. NICOLE gets up to leave the bedroom, leaving the door slightly open. Light spills in from the hallway. The End                                        October, 1
